doc.name: pixmapID
doc.summary: Specifies the ID of the data structure the operating system uses to hold the screen image of the current card.

examples.example: get colorAnimate(the pixmapID of this stack) -- an XFCN

description.p: Use the pixmapID property to pass to an external that needs to manipulate the window.
The pixmapID of a stack is an integer.
This property is read-only and cannot be set.
Important! The pixmapID property is not supported in version 2.7 of LiveCode and always returns 0.
The pixmap ID is provided by the operating system.
Some externals need to manipulate the contents of the image directly, and do so by referencing the ID. Such externals require you to pass the ID when you use the external.
